A **touchstone** is a type of [gem](/wiki/Gem "Gem") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It appears as a [gray stone](/wiki/Gray_stone "Gray stone") when unidentified.

## Generation

All [Archeologists](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") start the game with an identified uncursed touchstone.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

The [shopkeeper](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") of a jewelery [shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop") is always generated with a touchstone.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

The Mimic of the Mines map of [Mines' End](/wiki/Mines%27_End "Mines' End") has a [mimic](/wiki/Mimic "Mimic") pretending to be a touchstone.

## Description

Touchstones are used to identify valuable gems (including other gray stones), either directly or informally: [Applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a touchstone to a gem, or else [rubbing](/wiki/Rubbing "Rubbing") the gem on the touchstone, while you are not [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") will produce a different message depending on the gem and the touchstone's beatitude.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

A valuable gem will leave streaks of that gem's color on an uncursed touchstone, while [worthless glass](/wiki/Worthless_glass "Worthless glass") will instead leave scratch marks;[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) rubbing either type of gem on another gray stone will leave colored scratch marks.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7) A blessed touchstone will immediately [identify](/wiki/Identify "Identify") the gem and [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") itself if unidentified - an Archeologist or a [gnomish](/wiki/Gnome_\(starting_race\) "Gnome (starting race)") character in any role can use uncursed touchstones as though they were blessed.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8) A cursed touchstone has a 1⁄5 chance of shattering non-gray stone gems that are rubbed on it.[\[9\]](#cite_note-shatter-9)

Any item made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") will produce a signature "scritch, scritch" noise when a touchstone is applied or rubbed against it, and any gem will produce the same message if you are blind while using the touchstone.[\[10\]](#cite_note-10) Using a touchstone while [hallucinating](/wiki/Hallucinating "Hallucinating") will produce [YAFM](/wiki/YAFM "YAFM") without identifying the gem.[\[11\]](#cite_note-fractal-11) Items made of other materials produce distinct messages when rubbed on a touchstone or one is applied to them.

## Strategy

Touchstones can significantly ease inventory management even when uncursed: worthless glass can be informally identified, type-[named](/wiki/Name "Name") and then subsequently discarded to save space in your pack or [bags](/wiki/Bag "Bag"), allowing you to at least save resources in formally identifying valuable gems by other means. A blessed touchstone allows you to sell fully-identified valuable gems for full price and get the full [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck") bonus for throwing them to [unicorns](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn").

Touchstones also have some limited use in distinguishing iron items from others in their object class using the signature noise that applying one produces. This can be used to informally identify [gauntlets of power](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_power "Gauntlets of power") and [kicking boots](/wiki/Kicking_boots "Kicking boots"), or else eliminating them as the identity of non-iron [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves") and [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots"), though gauntlets of power can also be worn to auto-identify them if they are known to not be cursed.

### Identification

The most reliable means of identifying a touchstone is to apply it to an [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron") item or rub the item on it, ensuring you are not blind - it will produce a signature "scritch, scritch" as mentioned previously. [Price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification") is also reliable for identifying touchstones, as they are the only gray stone with a base price of 45[zm](/wiki/Zm "Zm").

While hallucinating prevents you from actually using a touchstone to identify gems, attempting to do so will produce a specific message that can indirectly identify an uncursed gray stone as a touchstone.

## History

The touchstone first appears in [NetHack 3.4.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.0 "NetHack 3.4.0").

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, Archeologists start out at basic skill level in [slings](/wiki/Sling "Sling") as a side effect of their starting touchstone, which is considered sling [ammunition](/wiki/Ammunition "Ammunition"). This is [bug C343-355](/wiki/Bugs_in_NetHack_3.4.3#Bug_C343-355 "Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3"), and was fixed in May 2008 via [commit d5ca34a4](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/d5ca34a45b80450620cf689d8c25acc5b3f1876d).

## Messages

- "scritch, scritch"

  You rubbed an iron item on a touchstone while not blind, or rubbed any gem on a touchstone while blind.

- You see \<color> streaks on the stone.

  You rubbed a valuable gem on an uncursed touchstone.

- You make scratch marks on the stone.

  You rubbed a piece of worthless glass on an uncursed touchstone.

- Oh wow, man: Fractals!

  You tried to use a touchstone while hallucinating.[\[11\]](#cite_note-fractal-11)

- You make \<color> scratch marks on the stone.

  You rubbed a gem on a non-touchstone gray stone.

* A sharp crack shatters \<one of> the \<gem(s)>.

  You destroyed a gem by rubbing it on a cursed touchstone.[\[9\]](#cite_note-shatter-9)

* You feel something shatter.

  As above, while blind.[\[9\]](#cite_note-shatter-9)

* Oh, wow, look at the pretty shards.

  As above, while hallucinating.[\[9\]](#cite_note-shatter-9)

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), touchstones can only be used on gems - the [whetstone](/wiki/Whetstone "Whetstone") is added for use with weapons.

Dipping a touchstone into a [potion of amnesia](/wiki/Potion_of_amnesia "Potion of amnesia") will turn it into a [flint stone](/wiki/Flint_stone "Flint stone").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), [giant](/wiki/Giant_\(starting_race\) "Giant (starting race)") characters can use uncursed touchstones as blessed, though they also start the game with knowledge of all worthless glass.

### notdNetHack

In [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), [Cavepeople](/wiki/Cavepeople "Cavepeople") can make a touchstone into a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear") head that inflicts +3d5 [study](/wiki/Study "Study") on hit.

## Encyclopedia entry

"Gold is tried by a touchstone, men by gold."

\[ Chilon (c. 560 BC) ]
